title: League Client Security Alert? @Riot
body:
When I go to the store or look at skins of champions, why do I get a Security Alert about a certificate that can't be verified. 

Then when I click yes to proceed the store come up with a 403 Forbidden Error with cloudflare-nginx below it.

How do I fix this? This is the first time it has happened to me.

replies.body: why i cant login and when i check the server there is nothing ?

The legacy client uses Internet Explorer to load assets, so there may be a setting through that browser that might be causing it to happen.  In this case, try resetting your IE settings to default to see if it helps.  Let me know!

This is how i fixed it : 
restart ur client, go to shop, w8 for this to pop out http://prntscr.com/eqnepn ; press no go to home and a gain to shop u will get sesson expired then go back home and to shop again. np

We noticed earlier today that this was an issue affecting a number of players. We're already working on a fix, and you can stay updated on our progress in our post [**here**](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/lKb27XVQ-problems-getting-the-store-to-load).
Why does the status page not mention this issue then?
It is happening to me also. I am using the old client.

Riot, please confirm. There is a store issue. Security alert when I access the store. It states that there is not a secure connection, and asks if I would like to proceed. I am using the Legacy Client. When I attempted the alpha/beta client the store would not pop up whatsoever. However, in the legacy client I would continuously press the store button and it would force the store menus to appear. Riot is aware of it seeing as how they removed their featured sale items from the home page. I am using Windows 10.

Same thing for us... except ONLY on our WindowsXP computers (we have 3 of them).  Windows 7 can access the store just fine.  Probably an issue with Internet Explorer certificates.
are you using the new or the old launcher?
